answers.answer: Normal people usually do not have protein in urine. However, Low levels of protein in the urine is also considered normal."How soon can I expect to have my kidneys damaged and what can i  do to slow this process down?"What did your doctor say? What are you're doing to control and manage your diabetes? How often do you test? What are your daily glucose levels? Are you eating a diabetic diet? Exercising daily? At normal body weight? Drinking at least 25 oz of water daily? Prevention is the key. Start by controlling and managing your diabetes.

question: I have been diagnosed with diabetes type 2 a couple of years ago and just recently my doctor said that there is a small amount of  protein in my urine.  How soon can I expect to have my kidneys damaged and what can i  do to slow this process down?
title: diabetes and kidney health
